business.headline: Sensex, Nifty edge higher as markets react to US Fed rate cutBenchmark indices in India showed modest gains following the US Federal Reserve's third rate cut of the year. Analysts recommend caution despite easing volatility, citing both global and technical factors that could impact market direction.

Large vs mid vs small cap: What makes sense for your money in a falling marketExperts expect small-cap and mid-cap stocks to outperform as the broader market stabilises. Since most retail investors hold a larger share of their portfolios in these two categories, any rebound is likely to directly benefit them.

Intel's deals helped boost CEO Lip-Bu Tan's personal fortune, says reportThe report detailed how Tan's dual roles as Intel's CEO and a venture capitalist have led to potential conflicts of interest involving several of his portfolio companies.

India trade deal offer best ever, but tough nut to crack: US official amid talksThe US and India have opened critical trade talks in New Delhi, with India presenting its best market access offer yet, according to US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer. The discussions aim to resolve tariff disputes and firm up a trade deal between the two countries.

US Fed cuts rates for third time in a row: What it means for your moneyThe US Federal Reserve reduced its key interest rate for the third time in a row on Wednesday. It also signalled that it may leave rates unchanged in the coming months.

Reforms and young talent are powering India's growth, say expertsThe country's strong GDP growth and controlled inflation are "great reasons to rejoice", adding that robust macro factors are also helping stabilise labour markets and household well-being, said the expert.

Air India admits compliance culture needs overhaul after flying Airbus without permitAir India last week called the Airbus November incident "regrettable" and said that some people had been suspended, while India's civil aviation watchdog DGCA ordered the aircraft to be grounded and called for an investigation.

Markets trade in red: Is this the right entry point for long-term investors?India's stock market has been one of the weakest performers globally in 2025 so far. The Sensex has delivered just 1.9% returns, making it the worst performer among 17 major global indices, while the Nifty 50 has risen only 3.2%.
Sensex closes 275 points lower, Nifty below 25,800; Eternal down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 275.01 points to close at 84,391.27, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 81.65 points to end at 25,758.00.

US delegation in Delhi, trade pact talks making headway: Piyush GoyalCommerce Minister Piyush Goyal announced steady progress in India-US trade talks with the US team visiting New Delhi. The agreement aims to resolve tariff disputes and significantly expand bilateral trade by 2030.

Why are young millennials leaving cities and better pay?If cities offer better pay and faster growth, why are so many young millennials moving out? What's making suburban living more appealing than the urban hustle? Let's break it down.

From AIS mismatches to capital gains confusion: Biggest tax mistakes of 2025With more Indians juggling salary, digital earnings, investments and gig income, tax filings in 2025 saw a jump in errors. The biggest trouble areas were AIS mismatches and confusion around capital gains, leading to incorrect returns.

Amazon bets big on India with $35 billion investment: 5 things to knowBy 2030, Amazon plans to create an additional 3.8 million direct, indirect, induced and seasonal jobs in India. These roles are expected to come from the expansion of its core businesses and the rapid scaling of its fulfilment and last-mile delivery network.

Can trading less really make you more profitable? Zerodha's Nithin Kamath explainsNithin Kamath shares insights on trading frequency, platform incentives, and the approach taken to protect clients from excessive trading.

Hinge founder Justin McLeod steps down to launch new AI dating platform OvertoneHinge founder Justin McLeod is stepping down after nearly fifteen years to lead Overtone, a new AI-powered dating venture backed by Match Group.
Aequs lists at 13% premium: Should you book profits or hold?Aequs share price: The stock listed at Rs 140 on both the NSE and the BSE, compared with its issue price of Rs 124.

Amazon to invest $35 billion in India, support 3.8 million jobs by 2030With markets tightening globally, Amazon's $35 billion India bet underlines confidence in the country's digital demand, logistics scale and workforce depth as growth drivers through the next decade for investment.

IndiGo flight crisis hits Delhi trade, loss estimated at Rs 1,000 crore: Trade bodyCTI Chairman Brijesh Goyal said that daily flight disruptions have severely impacted the movement of traders, tourists and business travellers, leading to a sharp fall in market activity across the city.
Meesho share price: Stock lists at 46% premium over IPO priceThe stock debuted at Rs 162.05 on the NSE and Rs 161.20 on the BSE, marking a gain of nearly 46% over its issue price of Rs 111.

Corona Remedies IPO Day 3: Check subscription status, latest GMP and moreInvestor interest in the Corona Remedies IPO has surged, with strong demand and key brokerages recommending a long-term approach.

entertainment.headline: BTS's Jungkook faces fan backlash over Ramen post amid rumoured Winter romance BTS' Jungkook has sparked intense online debate after sharing a casual ramen Instagram Story amid growing rumours linking him to aespa's Winter. While some fans criticised his silence and timing, others defended his right to privacy and personal life.

Abhishek says Aaradhya unaware of separation rumours, Aishwarya taught her well Abhishek Bachchan dismisses separation rumours and reveals daughter Aaradhya is unaware. The couple has legally safeguarded their family's digital rights amid growing online speculation.

The Dhurandhar scene no one's talking about: The rape attempt on Ranveer's Hamza Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar delivers its most haunting moment in a near-rape scene involving Hamza. It's a sequence that shatters Bollywood's hero mythology and exposes the film's real power struggle.

Chinmayi Sripada gets morphed image, says her children received death threats Singer Chinmayi Sripada recently revealed that she got her morphed AI image. In a video on X, she detailed and shared that her children also received death threats.

Dileep's Bha Bha Ba trailer out after acquittal, Mohanlal cameo steals the show The trailer for Dileep's upcoming Malayalam film Bha Bha Ba was launched on December 10 after his acquittal in the 2017 actor assault case. The film, featuring a special appearance by Mohanlal, is positioned as a major comeback for Dileep.

Dhurandhar box office Day 6: Ranveer Singh-Akshaye Khanna's film hits Rs 180 crore Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar continues its strong box office run, crossing Rs 180 crore in just six days with consistently high daily earnings. Directed by Aditya Dhar, the film's real-world geopolitical backdrop and powerful ensemble cast have contributed to its growing momentum and industry acclaim.

The Devil release: Darshan fans celebrate as actor appeals from prison Kannada actor Darshan's fans celebrate the release of The Devil as he is in Ballari prison in a murder case. The celebrations show unwavering support despite ongoing legal troubles.

Darshan thanks fans from prison, urges support for The Devil amid legal battle Kannada actor Darshan Thoogudeepa, currently in Ballari Central Prison on murder charges, released a statement through his wife Vijayalakshmi, expressing gratitude to supporters and encouraging them to focus on his upcoming film, The Devil.

Rajinkanth's Padayappa got more than an iconic villain in Ramya's Neelambari As Padayappa returns to theatres after 25 years to mark Rajinikanth's 75th birthday, the spotlight is as much on the hero as the woman who never left popular memory. Ramya Krishnan's Neelambari was never just a villain – she was the film's most unsettling truth.

Sara Arjun shares emotional note for Aditya Dhar, calls him the real Dhurandhar Sara Arjun shared an emotional note for Dhurandhar director Aditya Dhar, praising his guidance, kindness and steady leadership during her Bollywood debut. She credited him for empowering her, shaping her growth and creating a safe space where she could dream bigger.

Not f**king apologising: Amanda Seyfried reacts to backlash over Kirk comment Amanda Seyfried has refused to apologise for calling Charlie Kirk "hateful," reiterating that her comments were factual and taken out of context following his murder. While condemning his killing as "disturbing and deplorable," she urged for nuance in public debates and denounced rising violence in the country.

Alia Bhatt receives Golden Globe Horizon award at Red Sea Film Festival At the 5th Red Sea International Film Festival, Alia Bhatt was honoured with the Golden Globe Horizon Award and celebrated with a curated retrospective of her career. The festival also featured a first look at her upcoming female-led action thriller Alpha.

Russell Crowe says Gladiator II misunderstood the original's moral core Russell Crowe has once again criticised Gladiator II, saying the sequel misunderstood the emotional and moral essence that made the original iconic. The actor questioned key plot changes and revealed fans have also expressed disappointment to him directly.

Not drama, but magic: Mohanlal reflects on seven seasons of Bigg Boss Malayalam Actor Mohanlal shared insights on his seven-season experience hosting 'Bigg Boss Malayalam' at an event. He highlighted the show's positive impact and confirmed its future with three more years signed.

Hrithik Roshan praises Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar, but questions its politics Actor Hrithik Roshan has applauded the film 'Dhurandhar' for its storytelling while expressing his disagreements with its political undertones. He joined the list of celebrities who have shared their views on the film.

Exclusive: Ajinkya Deo says Ramayana co-star Ranbir Kapoor has 'payaas' aura Actor Ajinkya Deo discussed his role as Vishwamitra in Nitesh Tiwari's 'Ramayana'. During an exclusive chat, he opened up about his interactions with Ranbir Kapoor and said he has a pure aura.

Akshay Kumar reviews Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar: I'm blown away Akshay Kumar has joined the growing chorus of public figures praising 'Dhurandhar'. On Wednesday, the actor shared how deeply the Ranveer Singh-starrer affected him.

Nushrratt Bharuccha explains why male-dominated films do so well in India Bollywood actor Nushrratt Bharuccha shared her views on male-dominated films and the challenges faced by women actors. She also revealed details about her upcoming thriller film.

Priyanka Chopra can't stop laughing as Kapil Sharma cracks a joke on set. Watch Priyanka Chopra joined Kapil Sharma on the set of 'The Great Indian Kapil Show Season 4'. The duo posed for the paparazzi and exchanged light-hearted banter, delighting fans and photographers alike.

general news.headline: Luthra brothers, owners of Goa nightclub, detained in Thailand 5 days after fireSaurabh and Gaurav Luthra, owners of the Goa nightclub who fled to Thailand hours after a massive fire killed 25, have been detained in Phuket.

India offering best-ever trade deal, but tough nut to crack: US officialThe US and India have opened critical trade talks in New Delhi, with India presenting its best market access offer yet, according to US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer. The discussions aim to resolve tariff disputes and firm up a trade deal between the two countries.

PM, Putin's car selfie in US Congress as lawmaker warns of strained tiesThe Congresswoman urged lawmakers to move with incredible urgency to mitigate the damage this administration has done to the US-India partnership and return to steady cooperation.

Strikes on Afghan civilians are acts of war: India denounces Pakistan at UNIndia strongly condemned Pakistan's airstrikes in Afghanistan during the UN Security Council session. The attacks raise serious concerns over regional stability and international law violations, India said.

Hrithik Roshan praises Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar, but questions its politicsActor Hrithik Roshan has applauded the film 'Dhurandhar' for its storytelling while expressing his disagreements with its political undertones. He joined the list of celebrities who have shared their views on the film.

Live: Electoral reforms to be discussed in Rajya Sabha todayParliament Winter Session Live Updates: Two stormy debates on Vande Mataram and electoral reforms have set the tone as the Winter Session of the Parliament will enter its ninth day on Thursday. On Wednesday, Lok Sabha saw a direct clash between Union Home Minister Amit Shah and Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi, after the latter accused the BJP and the Election Commission of orchestrating "vote chori".

Gandhi dared Shah to debate the claims he made across three press conferences in the past. Shah dismissed the challenge, saying he wouldn't tailor his remarks to suit the Opposition's script or reorder his arguments on demand. The session, which began on December 1, will run until December 19. Stay tuned to indiatoday.in for all the latest updates.

Is Yunus regime Hasina 2.0? New data on killings reveals more of the sameNew data from human rights groups shows that extrajudicial killings and custodial torture have continued largely unabated under Muhammad Yunus's interim regime. For many Bangladeshis, the promise of justice by Yunus in the post-Sheikh Hasina, now might look increasingly like a replay of the past.

Will Trump be the president who lost India? US lawmaker warns tariffs backfiringUS lawmakers voiced fresh concerns over the Trump administration's handling of the US–India relationship, warning that unpredictability on tariffs, immigration and foreign policy risks weakening a partnership central to America's Indo-Pacific strategy.

The Dhurandhar scene no one's talking about: The rape attempt on Ranveer's HamzaRanveer Singh's Dhurandhar delivers its most haunting moment in a near-rape scene involving Hamza. It's a sequence that shatters Bollywood's hero mythology and exposes the film's real power struggle.

2 Madhya Pradesh friends find diamond worth Rs 50 lakh after digging for 20 daysTwo friends from Panna district found a 15.34-carat gem-quality diamond worth over Rs 50 lakh during mining. They have deposited the gem at the Panna Diamond Office and plan to use the proceeds for their sisters' weddings.

Indians are getting protein but of poor quality. ExplainedNearly half of India's at-home protein comes from cereals, crowding out better-quality protein sources.  A new study highlights India's dependence on a narrow set of crops, for both nutrition and farmer income.

Keep Your Little Ones Cozy This Winter with Amazon Everyday EssentialsWhether you're looking to care for little ones or find the perfect gift, this collection of baby and kids' essentials brings together nourishment, comfort, and thoughtful design.

Rajinkanth's Padayappa got more than an iconic villain in Ramya's NeelambariAs Padayappa returns to theatres after 25 years to mark Rajinikanth's 75th birthday, the spotlight is as much on the hero as the woman who never left popular memory. Ramya Krishnan's Neelambari was never just a villain – she was the film's most unsettling truth.

After ED heat on DMK Minister in corruption case, son meets Nirmala SitharamanTamil Nadu Minister Arun Nehru's meeting with Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman came days after the Enforcement Directorate sought an FIR in a Rs 1,020 crore graft case involving his father, KN Nehru.

Luthra brothers booked Thailand tickets as firemen were battling Goa club blazeGoa Police revealed that the Luthra brothers booked flights to Thailand while rescue teams battled the deadly fire at their Anjuna nightclub. Their sudden departure amid the tragedy has sparked intense investigation and legal battles.

Rohit Sharma is Dhurandhar, Chahal is Baahubali: Yashasvi JaiswalIndia vs South Africa: Opener Yashasvi Jaiswal compared Rohit Sharma to the movie Dhurandhar in the Agenda AajTak summit. Jaiswal spoke about the care that Rohit has for the junior India stars.

Shahid Afridi sparks feud with Gautam Gambhir: He thought whatever he says is rightShahid Afridi has reignited his long-standing feud with Gautam Gambhir, accusing the current Indian coach of having an attitude. Afridi also backed Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli to continue until the 2027 ODI World Cup, calling them the backbone of India's batting.

Sperm donor with cancer gene used for nearly 200 children across EuropeNearly 200 children across Europe were conceived using sperm carrying a dangerous cancer-linked gene mutation. Children conceived using these affected sperm cells have the mutation in every cell of their body.

Delhi AQI on brink of very poor again after 3-day respite, many areas breach 300The capital's AQI was at 285, a few notches below the very poor category, according to the Central Pollution Control Board, on Thursday morning. Several monitoring stations, meanwhile, recorded an above-300 air quality index at the time of writing this report.

Dileep's Bha Bha Ba trailer out after acquittal, Mohanlal cameo steals the showThe trailer for Dileep's upcoming Malayalam film Bha Bha Ba was launched on December 10 after his acquittal in the 2017 actor assault case. The film, featuring a special appearance by Mohanlal, is positioned as a major comeback for Dileep.

Lady Singham vs TVK's Bussy: Why is IPS Isha Singh making waves in Tamil NaduThe confrontation with TVK general secretary Bussy Anand in Puducherry made her viral, but there's far more to Isha Singh's story. A lawyer-turned IPS officer shaped by principled parents, now carrying that legacy into uniform.

Darshan thanks fans from prison, urges support for The Devil amid legal battleKannada actor Darshan Thoogudeepa, currently in Ballari Central Prison on murder charges, released a statement through his wife Vijayalakshmi, expressing gratitude to supporters and encouraging them to focus on his upcoming film, The Devil.

Dhurandhar: Rehman Dakait's impact over hyped, says widow of Pak's super copRehman Dakait, who committed his violent crime at the age of 13, lived only for 34 years but in those years, he committed Karachi's most gruesome murders. At 13, he stabbed someone and at the age of 19, he murdered his own mother.
Lancet reports 15 lakh pollution deaths in India annually; govt says no dataGovernment stance clashes with mounting scientific evidence on air-pollution mortality.

sports.headline: Shahid Afridi sparks feud with Gautam Gambhir: He thought whatever he says is right Shahid Afridi has reignited his long-standing feud with Gautam Gambhir, accusing the current Indian coach of having an attitude. Afridi also backed Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli to continue until the 2027 ODI World Cup, calling them the backbone of India's batting.

ICC Rankings: Rohit Sharma Retains Top Spot, Virat Kohli Climbs To No. 2 This news report highlights the latest ICC ODI rankings released on Wednesday, December 10, where Indian cricket stalwarts Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli have solidified their dominance. Despite facing questions regarding their ODI future just a few weeks prior, both players have silenced detractors by securing the top two spots in the batting charts. Rohit Sharma retains the number one position with 781 rating points, following a Man of the Series performance in Australia and two half-centuries in South Africa. Virat Kohli has climbed two places to the number two spot, pushing New Zealand's Daryl Mitchell and Afghanistan's Ibrahim Zadran to third and fourth respectively. The report notes that Kohli is now just eight rating points behind his teammate. The duo has emerged as India's top run-scorers in the last six ODIs, proving their indispensable value to the team.

India Eyes 2-0 Lead Against South Africa in Mullanpur's First Men's International In this sports update, the focus is on the second T20 International between India and South Africa. Following a comprehensive 101-run victory in the series opener at Cuttack, the 'Men in Blue' are looking to build on their success and take a crucial 2-0 lead in the series. The action now shifts to Mullanpur, which is set for a special occasion as it hosts its first-ever men's international match. The report highlights that while the pitch conditions remain a mystery for both sides, historical IPL records at the venue suggest a slender 6-5 advantage for teams batting first. Additionally, India aims to further strengthen their impressive 6-2 head-to-head record against South Africa in recent encounters.

Yashasvi Jaiswal dreams of playing T20 World Cup, open to being future India captain Yashasvi Jaiswal might be a sure-shot starter in the Test team, but he still dreams of making his mark in white-ball cricket and aspires to one day play in the T20 World Cup. He also revealed that he would like to lead the Indian team in the future.

Delhi Capitals IPL 2026 auction strategy explained: Five players DC can target IPL 2026 mini auction: With a purse of Rs 21.70 crore, Delhi Capitals enter the IPL 2026 mini auction needing immediate top-order reinforcement and multiple overseas signings as they look to fix their playing XI for the upcoming season.

Can Shubman Gill find his rhythm in home comfort to silence critics? IND vs SA, 2nd T20I: India vice-captain Shubman Gill has struggled for form and will be looking to find his feet as India look to extend their dominance on his home ground in the second T20I against South Africa on Thursday in Mullanpur.

Lionel Messi in India: Complete schedule of GOAT tour, starting on December 13 Lionel Messi is set to visit India on a 3-day tour. Messi will travel to four cities Kolkata, Hyderabad, Mumbai and New Delhi during his stay.

2nd T20I Predicted XIs: Will India change the winning combination? India (IND) v South Africa (SA) 2nd T20I Predicted XIs: Leading 1–0 in the five-match T20I series, a well-rounded India will look to extend their dominance over South Africa in the second T20 International on Thursday.

Too much pollution: National boxing championships in Greater Noida rescheduled The elite national boxing championships have been rescheduled to January due to pollution in Greater Noida. This comes after persistent issues in the area.

Germany win 8th Jr.men's Hockey World Cup title in shootout thriller with Spain Germany overcame Spain 3-2 in a shootout following a 1-1 draw in regulation time, claiming their eighth FIH Men's Hockey Junior World Cup. Goalkeeper Jasper Ditzer played a decisive role, denying Spain their first world title.

New ISL roadmap? AIFF to discuss club-led consortium at its AGM on Dec 20The All India Football Federation (AIFF) has indicated it is open to ISL clubs forming a consortium to run the league this season, with no timely resolution yet from the federation or the Sports Ministry on the ongoing football impasse.

Messi magic to grip Kolkata: Superstar to unveil 70-foot statue of himselfLionel Messi magic is all set to grip Kolkata as the city gets ready to welcome the Argentina superstar on December 13. Messi is set to receive a grand welcome in the city with celebrity-studded events.

Great achievement after being down 0-2: Sreejesh proud of India's podium finishPR Sreejesh could barely hide his pride as he reflected on India's junior men's stirring 4-2 comeback win over Argentina that secured the bronze medal at the FIH Junior Men's World Cup on Wednesday, giving the country its first podium finish in nine years.

Gill likely to get A+ BCCI contract, will Rohit, Virat be snubbed?India Test captain Shubman Gill is likely to be named in the A+ category in the upcoming BCCI annual contract list. There are also questions about whether Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma will be retained in the central contracts.

From struggle to stardom: Yashasvi on how his family carried him to Indian teamYashasvi Jaiswal revealed how his family carried him during tough times to help complete the dream of playing for India. Jaiswal has represented India in all three formats of the game.

Rohit Sharma is Dhurandhar, Chahal is Baahubali: Yashasvi JaiswalIndia vs South Africa: Opener Yashasvi Jaiswal compared Rohit Sharma to the movie Dhurandhar in the Agenda AajTak summit. Jaiswal spoke about the care that Rohit has for the junior India stars.

I don't think I love anything more than cricket: Smriti MandhanaMaking her first public appearance after cancelling her wedding, Smriti Mandhana says one truth has become clearer to her than anything else over the past 12 years: there is nothing she cares about more deeply than cricket.

Ben Stokes shoulders too much responsibility: Healy decodes England's Ashes woesAustralian cricketer Alyssa Healy, decoding England's poor performance in the ongoing Ashes, believes captain Ben Stokes is overburdening himself during the 2025–26 series.

Cameron Green to CSK? Chennai Super Kings mascot drops big hint before IPL auctionCSK teased their IPL 2026 auction strategy through a mascot video, hinting at key overseas signings as they aim to rebuild after a poor season where they finished at the bottom of the table.

Paris Olympics-inspired fightback! India rally to beat Argentina, claim 3rdJr.men's Hockey World Cup: India secured a thrilling comeback from two goals down to beat Argentina 4-2 in the third-place playoff in Chennai on Wednesday, December 10.

Arne Slot grateful as Liverpool fans chant his name amid Salah feud: Means a lotLiverpool's under-fire manager Arne Slot was grateful as fans chanted his name following his side's gritty 1–0 victory over Inter Milan at the San Siro, a result that delivered one of the biggest European statements of his troubled second tenure.

Tejaswi Jaiswal sacrificed cricket dreams. Now brother Yashasvi fuels his returnYashasvi Jaiswal's elder brother Tejaswi made his Syed Mushtaq Ali debut for Tripura. Tejaswi had earlier sacrificed his dream due to financial constraints and supported his brother by working as a salesman in Delhi.

England's mid-Ashes beach holiday slammed by media, but finds supporter in CareyEngland's mid-Ashes beach holiday may have been slammed by the Australian media, but has found an unlikely supporter in Alex Carey. England are yet to play a practice match in Australia.

Watch: Mandhana makes first public appearance since calling off wedding, hugs HarmanpreetSmriti Mandhana made her first public appearance on Wednesday after calling off her wedding with Palash Muchhal. Mandhana has also been named in India's squad for the T20I series against Sri Lanka.

Why India should leave Samson on bench for Jitesh? Deep Dasgupta explainsDeep Dasgupta has explained why India have decided to bench Sanju Samson from the lineup for Jitesh Sharma ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026. Samson has missed the last three T20Is for India.

Watch: Jemimah bursts into laughter after comparisons with viral Virat Kohli memeJemimah Rodrigues scored an unbeaten 115 to help India chase the highest total in Women's ODI history. Her celebration sparked memes comparing her to Virat Kohli, highlighting her rising star status.

Are KKR preparing to bring Venkatesh Iyer back home in IPL 2026 auction?IPL 2026: Venkatesh Iyer's release and Abhishek Nayar's praise have created an unexpected subplot ahead of the IPL 2026 mini-auction. The all-rounder now enters the bidding with renewed attention and a compelling narrative behind him.

After Islamabad bombing, Australia send delegation to Lahore before Pakistan tourAustralia has sent a security delegation to Lahore to review arrangements for their January T20I tour of Pakistan following the recent Islamabad bombing.

Ashes: Ben Stokes's beach pics go viral, Aussie media mock over-preparing PomsThe England team's trip to Noosa was slammed by the Australian media as the visitors struggle in the ongoing Ashes series. England are trailing in the Ashes 0-2 after their embarrassing loss in Brisbane.

PCB lifts Pakistan batter Haider Ali's suspension after rape allegation clearancePCB has lifted Haider Ali's suspension after UK authorities dropped the rape allegation, clearing him to resume his career in the upcoming BPL where he will play for Noakhali Express.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
